result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) and Operating w/ PAC (4th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Daniel A Arancibia was found guilty of OWI (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant in court, taken into custody with Attorney Michael J. Short.  Timothy Robert Verhoff appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Interp Fred S duly sworn. Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count 1.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

AMENDMENTS: 

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count # 2  . 

  Victim rights compliance.

COUNT #   1 
Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 3 years, cc to 21CT653 

CONDITIONS:
-Serve 90 days in DCJ, w/Huber and good time, cs to 21CT653

-Do not drive a MV w/o valid DL, agent approval, and IID
-Provide DNA sample
-Continue AODA treatment per Agent
-Any other conditions DOC may impose

COURT COSTS:
Ct #1
$600 Fine + cc
-All CC and DNA surcharge waived. Fine + V/W surcharge due on probation

-Revocation of drivers license for 36 months 
-Ignition Interlock Device required upon licensure for 36 months
-1/2 Price IID
-AODA assessment

CREDIT:
-Days credit if revoked: 0

DE advised of post-conviction rights

Copy of minutes emailed to DOC

Copy of minutes sent w/ bailiff

Casee T

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.
Defendant advised of right to and waived Preliminary Hearing (Preliminary Hearing Waiver signed); Court accepted waiver of Preliminary Hearing and ordered case bound over.

09:53 AM Defendant in court with Attorney Michael J. Short.  Timothy Robert Verhoff appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.
